WorkItem.Description:
When using Microsoft Code Contracts together with CAL a "duplicate module" exception is thrown since code contracts creates an additional assembly (AssemblyName).Contracts.dll which for some reason receives the "ModuleName" from the assembly (AssemblyName).
Â 
Not sure if this is a CAL or CC issue
WorkItem.Summary: duplicate module exception with code contracts

Comments.Message:
Hi,

We've tried adding code contracts to a Prism module, and we changed the configuration so that the contract reference assemby (the AssemblyName.Contracts.dll one) was built. We've experienced no errors when doing so.

We did verify that the assembly had the same name than the module's assembly, which could cause problems in case you are using a DirectoryModuleCatalog. If you're doing so, you could try using another method for module loading, such as defining them in a Xaml or App.config file.

If you are still experiencing this issue, it would be helpful if you could provide us with a repro sample of your application, so that we can help you find the cause of your problem.

Note that we've tested this using Code Contracts version 1.4.40314.1, with Prism v4.

Thanks,

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
